conclusion: Need to use properties of angles of incidence and refraction, and law of reflection to find the ratio.
Identify given angles: angle of incidence is 30 degrees, angle of refraction is 45 degrees.
Angle of reflection from surface O to edge N is 30 degrees.
Angle between light ray and edge N is 105 degrees using law of reflection.
Angle between light ray and edge N is 120 degrees.
Ratio of length of light-emitting part to total length of edge is tan(120 degrees) = -sqrt(3).
Ratio of length of light-emitting part to total length of edge is 1/6.
Final ratio of length of light-emitting part to length of edge is 1/6.
